section_1_text.eng:
ğŸ“– You can share books with your child anywhere - in the living room or bedroom, for example! 
Get rid of any distractions (like the TV ğŸ“ºâŒ). 
â° Pick a time every day when you can share books with your child. 
ğŸ’¡ If your child wants to, let them choose a book ğŸ˜ƒ
âœ¨ If you donâ€™t have any books - you can use anything with words and pictures, like old magazines or newspapers!

section_2_text.eng:
â­ From the book cover, ask your child what they think the story might be about. 
â¡ï¸ Throughout the book, ask who, what, where, when, why, and how questions.
âœ¨ If you have read a story many times, see if your child knows what comes next! 
ğŸ‘€ Describe whatâ€™s happening in a picture. Always use language that your child can understand. 
ğŸ’¡ Ask your child to retell the story.

section_3_text.eng:
ğŸ‘€ Notice what your child is interested in and talk about it. Help them understand the story, words, sounds, letters, and character emotions. ğŸ’š
ğŸ“– Explore by rephrasing or adding more information - help your child learn new words and understand more ğŸ˜ƒ
ğŸ‘‚ Respond positively and encourage them, even if what they are wrong.
ğŸ˜ƒ Ask your child to repeat what you have taught them.

section_4_text.eng:
ğŸ’™ Help your child build confidence by asking questions that they might know the answer to or that encourage them to go a bit further with their skill! 
ğŸ¨ Always connect whatâ€™s in the book to your childâ€™s experience.
